summary: The document is an agent report concerning the JFK Assassination System, focusing on an investigation into the 66th USA Artillery Detachment in the Federal Republic of Germany. It highlights the disqualification of Clyde E. Myers from nuclear weapons due to drug use, his engagement to Eva-Maria Dorka, and the absence of records for individuals named Jackson or Julius within the unit. The report, initially classified, was regraded to unclassified on 2 September 1994.
key_findings: Clyde E. Myers was disqualified from nuclear weapons due to drug usage.
Investigation found no records of individuals named Jackson or Julius in the unit.
The document was originally classified but was regraded to unclassified on 2 September 1994.
